data.event: Thornton, Idaho, originally called Texas Siding, is a townsite founded in 1917 and exists today as a township of Madison County, Idaho.
Thornton, Idaho, originally called Texas Siding, is a townsite founded in 1917 and exists today as a township of Madison County, Idaho.
Thornton's store was owned in the early 1900s by George Marler.

event.title: 1971 the Thornton Merc, which had replaced

data.event: In 1971 the Thornton Merc, which had replaced the two prior mercantile stores was operated by Mrs. Geraldine Evans.
